meanings.definition: A framework or skeleton used to support a sculpture or other structure.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully placed the armatures before starting to sculpt the clay.
meanings.sent2: The armatures of the building were made of strong steel beams.
meanings.sent3: The armatures in the art class seemed to be dancing when the students moved them around.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas formed an armature that supported the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The armatures of the bridge stood out against the blue sky, creating a striking image.

meanings.definition: A rotating coil or coils of wire in a motor or generator.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic checked the armatures in the motor for any signs of wear.
meanings.sent2: The armatures in the generator were responsible for producing electricity.
meanings.sent3: The armatures in the old generator seemed to have a mind of their own, spinning wildly.
meanings.sent4: The armatures hummed softly as the motor started, indicating they were working perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The shiny armatures gleamed under the bright lights of the workshop, showcasing their importance.
